content: हेमकूट The ‘golden-peaked’ mountain, one of the ranges of mountains which divide the known continent into nine {%Varṣas%} (वर्षपवर्त); it is generally supposed to be situated north of the Himālaya --or between the Meru and the Himālaya-forming with it the boundaries of the {%Kimpuruṣavarsha%} or abode of {%Kinnaras%}, cf <ls>K. 136.</ls> Kālidāsa speaks of it as ‘having plunged into the eastern and western oceans and emitting golden fluid’; see <ls>Ś. 7.</ls>
